This completes the instructions for Part 1. You may now proceed to create the next part, as necessary.</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions to generate the parametric CAD model** **Part 1: Cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on one side** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch** Create a new sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of two faces: face_1 and face_2. On face_1, draw a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.125, 0.1297] - Radius: 0.125 On face_2, draw a loop with four lines, with the following properties: - Line 1: Start Point: [0.4652, 0.0], End Point: [0.7152, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.7152, 0.0], End Point: [0.7152, 0.25] - Line 3: Start Point: [0.7152, 0.25], End Point: [0.4652, 0.25] - Line 4: Start Point: [0.4652, 0.25], End Point: [0.4652, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7152. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.75 units in the direction of the normal vector. **Step 5: Extrusion** For the extrusion, use the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.75 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.7152 - operation: Create a new solid body The extruded shape should be a cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on one side. **Additional Part Information:** - Shape: A 3D model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on one side - Length: 0.7152 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.7152 **Note**: The shapes and dimensions in the description correspond to the resulting 3D shape, not the intermediary sketches.</description>
